questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a best practice when using the FILTER function in DAX?

questions.B: Use FILTER to remove duplicate values
questions.C: Use FILTER to create a calculated table
questions.D: Use FILTER to apply multiple filters to a table

questions.A: Improved performance
questions.B: Reduced data duplication

questions.question: What is the difference between incremental refresh and full refresh in Power Query?
questions.A: Incremental refresh updates only the changed data, while full refresh updates the entire dataset
questions.B: Full refresh is faster than incremental refresh
questions.C: Incremental refresh can be scheduled more frequently than full refresh

questions.B: Normalized data structure

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid reason for a relationship to be inactive?
questions.A: The tables have no common columns.
questions.B: The tables have circular references.
questions.C: The tables have different data types in the common columns.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a composite model in Power BI?
questions.A: To combine data from multiple sources into a single model.
questions.B: To improve performance by using DirectQuery for some tables and Import for others.
questions.C: To create relationships between tables from different sources.
questions.D: To share data models with other users.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using DirectQuery in Power BI?
questions.A: Real-time data access.
questions.B: Improved performance for large datasets.

questions.question: What is the difference between a report and a model in Power BI?
questions.A: A report is a visualization of data, while a model is the underlying data structure.
questions.B: A model is a visualization of data, while a report is the underlying data structure.
questions.C: A report and a model are the same thing.
questions.D: A model is a subset of a report.

questions.question: Which of the following is a best practice for creating tooltips in Power BI reports?
questions.A: Use concise and informative text.
questions.B: Include images and charts to enhance visualization.
questions.C: Use tooltips to display data that is not visible in the report.
questions.D: Use tooltips to navigate to other pages in the report.

questions.question: What is the purpose of using a cardinality filter in a relationship in Power BI?
questions.A: To limit the number of rows that are returned from the related table.
questions.B: To ensure that the relationship is always active.
questions.C: To improve performance by reducing the number of calculations that are performed.
questions.D: To prevent circular references in the model.

questions.question: Which of the following is a scenario where it would be appropriate to use a composite model in Power BI?
questions.A: When you have data from multiple sources that need to be combined.
questions.B: When you have a large dataset that needs to be optimized for performance.
questions.C: When you need to share data models with other users.
questions.D: When you need to create complex visualizations.

questions.question: What is the difference between a many-to-many relationship and a one-to-many relationship in Power BI?
questions.A: In a many-to-many relationship, each row in one table can be related to multiple rows in another table, while in a one-to-many relationship, each row in one table can be related to only one row in another table.
questions.B: In a one-to-many relationship, each row in one table can be related to multiple rows in another table, while in a many-to-many relationship, each row in one table can be related to only one row in another table.
questions.C: There is no difference between a many-to-many relationship and a one-to-many relationship.
questions.D: A many-to-many relationship is always active, while a one-to-many relationship is always inactive.

questions.question: Which of the following is a best practice for optimizing the performance of a Power BI report?
questions.A: Use DirectQuery for large datasets.
questions.B: Create relationships between tables that have common columns.
questions.C: Use filters to limit the amount of data that is displayed.

questions.A: To calculate a value based on the data in the report.
questions.B: To create a visualization of data.
questions.C: To filter the data in the report.
questions.D: To navigate to other pages in the report.

questions.B: Card

questions.B: ISERROR

questions.C: Use it to replace error values with blank values
questions.D: Use it to create custom error messages

questions.question: Which of the following is a best practice when referencing columns and measures in DAX?
questions.A: Use the fully qualified name, including the table name.
questions.B: Use the short name, if it is unique.
questions.C: Use the alias name, if it is defined.
questions.D: Use the column or measure name, without any prefixes.

questions.question: When should you use the DIVIDE function in DAX?
questions.A: To divide two numbers.
questions.B: To calculate the percentage of a number.
questions.D: To round a number to a specific number of decimal places.

questions.question: What is the difference between the COUNTROWS function and the COUNT function in DAX?
questions.A: COUNTROWS counts the number of rows in a table, while COUNT counts the number of non-blank values in a column.
questions.B: COUNTROWS counts the number of non-blank values in a table, while COUNT counts the number of rows in a column.
questions.C: COUNTROWS and COUNT are the same function.
questions.D: COUNTROWS counts the number of unique values in a table, while COUNT counts the number of duplicate values in a column.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the SELECTEDVALUE function in DAX?
questions.A: To return the selected value of a slicer or filter.
questions.B: To return the current value of a measure.
questions.C: To return the default value of a parameter.
questions.D: To return the value of a variable.

questions.question: What is the best practice for using variables in DAX?
questions.A: Declare variables at the beginning of a measure or calculated column.
questions.B: Use variables to store intermediate values.
questions.C: Use variables to avoid repeating complex calculations.

questions.question: Which of the following is a reason to avoid using FILTER as a filter argument in DAX?
questions.A: It can lead to performance issues.
questions.B: It can make your code difficult to read and understand.
questions.C: It can cause errors if the filter expression is not evaluated correctly.

questions.question: You have a table of sales data with the following columns: Product, Sales, and Date. You want to create a measure that calculates the total sales for the current month. Which of the following DAX expressions would you use?
questions.A: Total Sales = SUM(Sales) FILTER(Date, Date >= TODAY() && Date <= TODAY() + 30)
questions.B: Total Sales = SUM(Sales) FILTER(Date, Date >= TODAY() && Date <= TODAY() + 30)
questions.C: Total Sales = CALCULATE(SUM(Sales), Date >= TODAY() && Date <= TODAY() + 30)
questions.D: Total Sales = SUM(Sales) WHERE(Date >= TODAY() && Date <= TODAY() + 30)

questions.question: You have a table of customer data with the following columns: CustomerID, CustomerName, and Sales. You want to create a measure that calculates the average sales for each customer. Which of the following DAX expressions would you use?
questions.A: Average Sales = AVERAGE(Sales) GROUPBY(CustomerID)
questions.B: Average Sales = AVERAGE(Sales) FILTER(CustomerID)

questions.question: You have a table of sales data with the following columns: Product, Sales, and Date. You want to create a measure that calculates the total sales for the current year. Which of the following DAX expressions would you use?
questions.A: Total Sales = SUM(Sales) FILTER(Date, YEAR(Date) = YEAR(TODAY()))
questions.B: Total Sales = SUM(Sales) FILTER(Date, YEAR(Date) = YEAR(TODAY()))

questions.question: You have a table of sales data with the following columns: Product, Sales, and Date. You want to create a measure that calculates the total sales for the current quarter. Which of the following DAX expressions would you use?
questions.A: Total Sales = SUM(Sales) FILTER(Date, QUARTER(Date) = QUARTER(TODAY()))
questions.B: Total Sales = SUM(Sales) FILTER(Date, QUARTER(Date) = QUARTER(TODAY()))
